text: SOON OUR PUBLICATION
Seven women walk in a circle and sweep away each other’s footsteps on a white, sandy floor.
A video shows a bowl of fruit decaying at an accelerated pace.
A foosball table accommodates 11 players on each side.
A Ping-Pong table with a lily pond in the center can be played by two to four players.
A large plasticine ball is rolled through city streets, picking up dust and debris.
Watermelons wearing empty cat food cans like hats.
A handful of clay is marked with the impressions of a man's fingers.
A large-scale video installation records the nocturnal activity in an artist's studio of his cat and an infestation of mice.
A man walks around the perimeter of a large square marked off with masking tape.
A young elephant is brought in a gallery, where a professional crew films her performing a series of tricks: play dead, stand still, back up
A Volkswagen Beetle attempts to climb up a hill over and over.
Half the air in a given space is comprised of thousands of air-inflated 11-inch ballons filling half of the room’s entire volume.
A french horn is filled with guacamole and offered with either blue or plain tortilla chips for dipping.
The over-sized shadow of two nails materializes on the ground and the wall.
90,000 persons measure themselves and mark their height on the walls of a white room.
A person runs every 30 seconds through a gallery. Each run is followed by an equivalent pause.
A cube is made up of stuffed animals assembled with wire and then burnt.
A parasol becomes a dog.
A perfect replica of a subway seat on top of which a cake floats as though levitating.
A thin sheet of glass cuts horizontally through the legs of a wooden chair.
A list suggests 101 art ideas you can do yourself.
2 zebras are portrayed on a snowy mountaintop.
A wall-mounted curtain of lights invades and shapes the environment in which it is placed.
Surveillance cameras observe a fox exploring some rooms of The National Gallery.
Persons are encouraged to touch one another in the dark.
A person floats mysteriously in mid-air, frozen in time and space as if defying the constraints of physics.
A man asked an actor to perform the role of a clown to the point of self-humiliation.
A sixteen foot-high bronze statue portrays the soccer player Zinedine Zidane’s head-butting incident against Marco Materazzi.
A man covers a canvas using garbage bags.
A man dressing in a long coat and hat, repeatedly kicks a can as he walks down an empty sidewalk in NYC.
A child sitting on a kitchen sink, tries to cut a stream of water with a pair of scissors.
A line of people moves along the seashore of a beach, following the fleeting border, defined by the waves, that parts the sea from the land.
A ceiling fan is installed too close to the corner of the room, that the blades damage the two walls, producing a repetitive sound.
A cup is next to a radio playing “Sailing by” four times a day on windowsill with river view.
Two table lamps, the shades of which are grown together like Siam twins, illuminate themselves without managing to produce useful light.
A blue chiffon sheet is blown by a fan.
An animatronic dancer moves lasciviously in front of a large mirror.
A Slovakian formed a queue of 10-20 people outside the Kunstverein in Cologne for half an hour.
A mariachi band plays Joy Division's "Transmission".
Several Puerto Ricans attempt to sing the national anthem of the United States.
A cat litter container is filled with crystals.
A man spreads jelly on bread letters.
A full-scale bicycle is fashioned from camel bone.
Dogs run after Formula One cars.
A man spews a stream of water from his mouth.
Camel humps are placed on an ironing board.
A crumpled pack of cigarettes turns in circles on the floor in an infinite movement.
A website continuously arranges a list of all the worlds national capitals according to their current air temperature.
An over 80 metres long iron snake winds through the architecture of a pavilion.
A three-dimensional reworking of Duchamp’s mustachioed Mona Lisa is made of bronze.
A small sculpture balances in between the space of two blinds.
A room is covered with gold lamé. In the centre there is a plinth on which is placed a massive sphere of rope made of hand-woven camel hair.
A series of neon lights is collected from over twenty art spaces in Paris.
Walls and floors of Palazzo Grassi are covered with a fire-resistant carpet that reproduces an Oriental motif.
Everyday objects create the silhouette of a man.
12 display cases contain a small human skull cast in colorless translucent glass.
A light bulb is filled with water.
A gigantic labyrinth-like structure is made from 14,000 casts of the inside of different boxes.
An half-hour-long film shows a sequence of chain reactions from ordinary objects assembled into elaborate configurations.
A war veteran faces a corner and does neither react nor respond to the audience.
A woman goes into a porn cinema wearing crotchless pants. She walks around the audience with her exposed genitalia at face level.
600 digital clocks are lined up along the entirety of a wall, simultaneously registering the relentless passage of time.
A group of dancers is lined up from wall to wall. The line rotates, obliging the public to move from one side of the room to the other.
Sheets of paper are catapulted into the air to create an ephemeral white wall of "rain".
A woman observes and examines her own naked body with a small, round hand-held mirror.
A man invites people to kiss him through a glass wall.
A man trails pedestrians on the streets of New York until they enter a private place.
People are invited to go behind a canvas and expose parts of their bodies out from a hole.
Never-ending fountains from which whisky and coconut water flow.
Two puppets repeat a million times "Thank You" to Andy Warhol.
An imagined hotel room defaced by Jimi Hendrix during a stay in Gothenburg back in the 60’s.
A novel is composed by a selection of tweets that include the phrase "working on my novel."
In Walt Disney's Jungle Book every character speaks a different language: Balou speaks Hebrew and Bagheera Arabic.
An amateur choir from Valls, Spain, sings the Windows startup and shutdown melody in the Sant Roc chapel.
A man runs, bikes and swims nearly 1,200 miles from Warsaw to Paris’s Père Lachaise cemetery, where Chopin was buried.
A man drags a small magnetic toy dog on wheels through Mexico City so as to attract debris to it.
A bicycle plays a 7 inch record mounted to the back wheel.
A man takes water from the Black Sea with a bucket and then pours it into the Red Sea.
Lifelike mannequins of an entire family are in a row. The parents are shrunk, while the two children are sprouted in size.
A collection of kitchen utensils are linked together and rendered uncanny through their interpenetration by electric light.
All characters and dialogue from well-known Warner Bros animations are erased, preserving only the backgrounds.
Two white flags appear on top of the Brooklyn Bridge.
A Dutch man falls voluntarily from the roof of a house.
Nylon tights are stuffed with fluff and are placed on plinths to create biomorphic forms.
A wardrobe is filled with cement and includes a chair literally entombed within it.
A spider made of bronze, stainless steel and marble measures over 30 ft high and 33 ft wide.
A carpet is made of phosphorescent stones.
A Japanese white pine bonsai suspended from a metal frame, and an arrangement of several blossoms are launched into the stratosphere.
A man was shot in his left arm by an assistant from a distance of about five meters with a .22 rifle
A plane piece of wood is modified by hammering provided nails.
A flat iron is transformed into a non-functional object, by the addition of a single row of fourteen nails.
A woman sits on a stage. People are invited to snip off her clothing.
A false sun is constructed from yellow light behind a semi-circular screen below a mirrored ceiling.
A starburst is made of approximately 30,000 toothpicks.
A mirror is placed in front of a closed circuit television.
A piece of mozzarella is put in a carriage.
A woman contorts herself to accommodate a variety of environments, from urban architecture to natural landscape.
Duchamp’s Fountain is reproduced in polished bronze.
The lifelike wax figure of Pope John Paul II is struck down by a meteor.
A battery powered clock placed & left behind somewhere inside a hollow wall.
The New York Times is rendered blank by chemical process and the extracted ink is turned into a miniature.
16 foot long line of cocaine is offered up on mirrors lining the floor.
17 cameras follow a unique player for the whole duration of a football match.
Two private investigators follow each other.
Alfred Hitchcock Psyco slowed down to approximately 2 frames a second. As a result it lasts for exactly 24 hours.
An actor masked and costumed as a comic-book version of Pablo Picasso greets visitors entering a Museum.
A washing machine dances psy-trance.
7000 fireworks go off at once because of a computer malfunction.
The letters “S.O.S.” are carved into the ground of Western Sahara near to a refugee camp. The graffiti measures 5x1.7km.
In a bag there are rubble from a terrorist bombing of an art centre in Milan.
A test wall painted with attempts to match the colour of coca-cola.
Inside a polyurethane and plaster structure, opera singers perform passages from the most significant speeches of the Twentieth Century.
Life-sized pictures of people found on Google's Street View are printed and posted at the same spot where they were taken.
Some objects are set on a table with rotating pedestals. Close-up lighting projects a changing shadow theatre onto the wall behind.
1,075 photos show 1,075 items that were detained or seized from passengers and mail entering the United States from abroad.
Three life-size mannequins hanging from the oldest tree in Milan.
All the bells in a country rung as quickly and loudly as possible for three minutes.
A life-size replica of the interior of a McDonald's burger bar, without any customers or staff present, gradually floods with water.
Vacuum cleaners are displayed in plexiglas cases.
A 340-ton granite megalith is placed on a 456-foot-long slot.
A pair of Nike shoes, a Kelly bag and a bottle of Evian water are cast in chromed bronze.
A 3 metres high hand-twisted balloon dog is crafted out of stainless steel.
An artistic choreographed song and dance is conveyed by a group of interpreters dressed as museum guards.
Four sunflower seeds are thrown on a huge field covered by hand-crafted sunflower seeds.
A huge field is composed by millions of sunflower seeds hand-crafted in porcelain.
A real family therapy method investigates the social relationships of people and objects portrayed in six popular works of art.
A film enlists an assortment of objects, including tyres and chairs, as components in a domino-like chain reaction lasting thirty minutes.
The sentence "every step I take in my life has led me here, now" is written on a marble plate at the Malpensa airport in Milan.
An armchair is made of soft toys attached.
A Chinese man manages to camouflage himself in any surroundings.
A white car towing a trailer emerges out of the floor.
A circular section is carved out of the façade of a disused building in Liverpool.
4 man-made waterfalls of monumental scale are installed on the shores of 4 New York waterfront.
In a website users can peel away the "surface" of the webpage as if it is a stack of monochromatic paper.
A skateboard leans on 4 cheeseburgers.
A series of photos feature people jumping in the air covered by various types of fabric and sheets.
16 photographs show homes expropriated by banks. The shots incorporate the date of eviction and the bank owner of the flat.
Famous people read mean tweets about themselves.
Ceramic tiles are juxtaposed with Nike trainers. The tiles conform to the shape of the Nike logo.
A mushroom cloud is made of brand new stainless steel utensils.
7,000 trees of various types are planted throughout the city of Kassel, in Germany, each with an accompanying basalt stele as a marker.
A chandelier made of underwear collected from friends and family is lit by two projections.
A piano is modified by carving a circular hole. A pianist standing in the void, behind the keyboard,attempts to play Beethoven’s Symphony.
A 43-foot tall West Highland terrier is made of 70.000 fresh flowers.
Behind a pane of tinted glass set into the sole cavity of a concrete bunker-like form, a looped film projection shows two men kissing.
A flag is placed between two working fans.
One million of Finnish replicas passports are collected in a fortress behind a bullet proof glass. They are eventually burned.
A great number of old air conditioners are arranged in shape of an igloo.
Most famous Greek philosophers play a football match against most famous German philosophers. Confucius is the referee.
A man walks back and forth along a straight line in the grass in the English countryside, leaving a track that he then photographs.
A man runs back and forth between two opposite walls placed 15 meters apart, impacting violently against them.
A German man shares a room with a wild American coyote, for eight hours over three days.
A man lies in the sun for five hours with an open book on his chest.
A cow and a calf – both of which are divided in half – are placed in a glass tank of formaldehyde.
A video compiles the reaction of random volunteers in front of what is supposed to be "the worst video ever".
In a videogame you control an horse pushing aimlessly a giant sphere across a mountain.
A man offers a $1,000 prize to any woman who could pin him in a wrestling match.
A woman carves the word "perra" into her skin, protesting the killing of women.
2 iPhones display the sunrise in the Maldives & sunset in California.
In a refrigeration chamber, the temperature of -30°C contrasts with a chair maintained at a constant +37°C by an internal thermostat.
A black person tells horrible jokes about black people.
A virtual sea is created with 17 thousand books open on pages showing photos of sea water.
Road kill are surrounded by makeshift graves.
The main character of a video-game is an old woman that can do nothing but walking very slowly and eventually die.
A brick is covered with the book cover of La Société du Spectacle by Guy Debord.
A painting depicts a Black Madonna surrounded by images from blaxploitation movies, close-ups of female genitalia, and elephant dung.
A tiger shark is preserved in formaldehyde in a vitrine.
A group of young men and women reenact the school play performed eighteen years before.
An homemade flamethrower is built by assembling waste materials.
A man pretends to be his father for seven years.
6000 boxes of Efes beer bottles are imported to Berlin from Turkey and piled as a pyramid. Visitors can pick and drink them in the room.
A large figure with a rabbit's head has a long spaghetti-like extension substituting for genitalia.
The Tabernas desert in Spain is crossed on an improvised cell powered bicycle. The only waste product the vehicle produced was water.
A large mound of hay conceals a needle, manifestly  illustrating a common saying.
A platoon of compressed air cylinders randomly empties itself.
A fox lies on the ground with a mouse tied to its belly with a belt.
A large crane sitting above a great pile of used clothes randomly grabs a number of the garments and deposits them a few yards further away.
A sequence of dozens of round objects are aligned one behind the other, from the ballpoint of a pen to a globe with a diameter of 2.5 metres
A ground made up of 22.00 eggs contrasts with a ceiling of 55.000 bullets.
A smashed guitar is placed inside a dismantled tent.
An instructional video explains you how to disappear from contemporary society, whether by camouflage or through physical annihilation.
The artificial bones of a 15 metres long whale skeleton are covered with a complex geometrical pattern in graphite.
the crushing of a lettuce is placed between a block of granite and a smaller stone, secured by a wire.
A glass cube is cut into thin layers and covered with ketchup.
A series of multicoloured carwash brushes turned automatically  at different speeds and intervals.
A globe spins so fast that you can see nothing but colors.
Thirty nine metronomes beat time, one at every speed.
A group of friends try to make a donkey fly.
Several pigs are tattooed with a diverse array of designs, including skulls, crosses and Louis Vuitton designs.
A mirror is placed in front of The little mermaid, in Copenhagen. The intervention creates a twin figure that stikes a visual cord.
The death of pop star Madonna is described in a BBC News special edition, with studio guests who go over the details of the car accident.
1000 people of all ages and gathered together scream as loud as possible at the same moment.
A car is cut lengthwise into 3 slices. The center slide is extracted and the left parts are rejoined in a new vehicle.
11 islands situated in a bay are surrounded with 603,870 sq.m of floating pink woven polypropylene fabric covering the surface of the water.
A metal wheel is mounted on a painted wood stool.
two sex dolls are placed on top of each other in the 69 sex position: despite appearing to be made of plastic they are cast in bronze.
A woman sits immobile in a museum's atrium, while spectators are invited to take turns sitting opposite her.
A photo-illusionistic wallpaper re-creates the environment of an artist studio.
59 lightbulbs are wired to the light of a Yokohama child’s room, via the internet.
A dictionary definition of "chair", a real chair and a photo of that chair are placed next to each other.
A full-size wax replica of Giambologna's The Rape of the Sabine Women slowly burns to the ground.
A crack in the floor runs the 167 metres of a hall. It begins as a hairline crack, then it widens and deepens across the space.
A projector is used as a dryer for a pair of shoes full of mud.
A human femur and a handle coffee cup hold a small sugar cube.
A fantasy sword impales 3 Axe Bodywash.
Five horses are stuck with their heads through a wall.
In an empty room new text is constantly added on a wall. When taking a closer look, the viewer discovers the text is talking about him.
A video composed with shared sunset photo's found with Google Image Search.
A canvas is placed under a weeping willow to which are tied several markers. The wind helps the markers draw on the canvas.
A dark room hosts a constellation of many led lights, placed on different, invisible electrical appliances.
Filaments of transparent glass beads come out from a canvas.
2 identical clocks are displayed adjacent on a wall.  They are set to the same time and they slowly lose synch.
A leopard meanders through 3,000 cappuccino cups.
A large metal plinth, inscribed with ‘The Base Of The World, Homage To Galileo’ is placed upside down in a field.
A man is running in a human-sized hamster wheel.
A real rabbit fluoresces green when exposed to blue light, thanks to genetic modification.
A small bird is perched atop a birdcage where an angry-looking cat is locked inside.
A giant marble middle finger is placed in front of the Milan stock market.
A complex machine turns food into poop, reenacting the digestive human process.
A 20 year old chimpanzee tries to assemble a six-lettered dice to spell “UTOPIA”.
A fire burns next to a snowman, which slowly melts.
122 portraits of actors playing a Nazi character in different European and American movies are set up on a wall.
In a silent, B/W video, a man cries for 3 minutes standing in front of the camera.
4 wheels are arranged in a room as if they were installed on a car.
All the elements of the video game Mario Brothers are erased except for the clouds.
A concrete cast of its interior replaces a 3-story Victorian terraced house in East London for 4 month, then is demolished.
11 people compete in telling the saddest stories of their lives. Whoever stops crying, loses.
An entire book about disappearance is written without using the letter "e".
a huge spiral made of basalt and mud is built on the shore of the Great Salt Lake.
A lead ball rests on the “g” key of a laptop, producing the letter “g” within the body of a Word document.
A LED display counts the number of human deaths occurring worldwide since the start of each year.
A pair of Nike shoes walks in the space, thanks to the vibration of dildos inside them.
An unadorned wooden cube contains a recording of the sounds produced during its construction.
"Life is Beautiful” is written in italics with knives into a wall.
4 spray cans are caught between two pillars. They spray to exhaustion.
The rotation of the solar system is reenacted by human beings.
2 identical clocks are displayed adjacent on a wall.  They are set to the same time and they slowly lose synch.
A large metal plinth, inscribed with ‘The Base Of The World, Homage To Galileo’ is placed upside down in a field.
A series of nudes representing women bodies are drawn using bananas as French curves.
A partially used bar of soap inlaid with a spiral of pubic hair.
Several immigrants are suspended on the staircase of a plane.
A floor in a room is lifted up by 40 cm. The furniture merges into the floor.
84 fish fly by plane over the Tasman Sea. Each one is in a glass bowl on its own seat.
A chandelier of more than 1000 lamps turns on every time lightning strikes in Italy.
A man goes from Tijuana to San Diego without crossing the border that separates U.S.A from Mexico.
A basketball and a soccer match are being played simultaneously on the same field.
A lecture about creativity and boundaries is delivered without ever using the letter R.
13 cactai from different species are aligned in a row, their height proportionally increasing.
A piece of marble from Bejing is transformed into a Corinthian capital during a sailing trip from China to Europe.
A full-size bread house is devoured by a dozen multicoloured parrots living in the same space.
300 cockroaches are trapped under 300 glasses.
A fruit basket is filled with peeled fruit.
A squirrel is carved into a peanut stolen from a squirrel.
A chandelier of more than 1000 lamps turns on every time lightning strikes in Italy.
A man pushes an ice block that weights like him through Mexico City until it melts down.
A Prada store is built in the middle of the Texan Desert.
